steps.message: Finally, we can create our subnets.

Select Subnets on the left in your VCN detail page.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/subnet_menu.png}}

At here we are going to create three Subnets, which will accommodate the Jump Server, Backend Servers and Load Balancer Listener.
Click on Create Subnet.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_subnet_button.png}}

Let's create jump_server_subnet first.
Let's assign the CIDR block to 10.0.1.0/24. Route table for this subnet is public_subnet_route_table since we want to access the jump server from Internet. This will also be a public subnet for public(Internet) access. Finally, the Security List will be jump_server_security_list that we created in the previous steps. We can leave all other fields as default. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_subnet_config_1.png}}{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_subnet_config_2.png}}

Next, let's create backend_server_subnet.
Assign the CIDR block to 10.0.2.0/24. Route table for this subnet is private_subnet_route_table. This will be a private subnet, so for Subnet Access, select private subnet. Finally, the Security List will be backend_server_security_list.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/backend_subnet_config_1.png}}{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/backend_subnet_config_2.png}}

Last, let's create load_balancer_subnet first.
Assign the CIDR block to 10.0.3.0/24. Route table for this subnet is public_subnet_route_table since we want to access from Internet. This will also be a public subnet. Finally, the Security List will be load_balancer_security_list.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_subnet_config_1.png}}{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_subnet_config_2.png}}
Now, all networking components are created, and we can move on to Step 2.
